article:
{{Multiple issues|




}}

'High Performance [[Capillary electrophoresis]]' ('HPCE') is widely used in the
analysis of biomolecules. Recently, a further application, to titer baculovirus,
has been developed using HPCE technology and a proprietary buffer system
belonging to the UK company deltaDOT. The application has been named deltaTITER
and uses a multi-pixel detection system to quantify the amount of virus present
in a sample. It offers several advantages over other approaches, the most
crucial being the tremendous saving in time and resource, especially over the
traditional plaque assay. The assay is highly reproducible, with a % RSD of less
than 6. The result is presented as an absorption peak, and quantified using
bespoke software.
